details.formulaStrippedArticleTitle: Persymmetric detectors with enhanced rejection capabilities
details.title: Persymmetric detectors with enhanced rejection capabilities
details.standardTitle: Persymmetric detectors with enhanced rejection capabilities
details.abstract: In this study, the authors deal with the problem of adaptive detection of point-like targets in Gaussian disturbance with unknown but persymmetric structured covariance matrix induced by the space and/or time symmetry of the sensing system. In this framework, they devise and assess two selective receivers exploiting the Rao test and the generalised likelihood ratio test design criteria. The performance assessment, conducted by Monte Carlo simulation, has shown that the proposed receivers can significantly outperform their unstructured counterparts and guarantee enhanced rejection performance of unwanted signals with respect to their natural competitors.

ieee.displayText: Antonio De Maio, Danilo Orlando, Chengpeng Hao, Goffredo Foglia, "Adaptive Detection of Point-Like Targets in Spectrally Symmetric Interference", Signal Processing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 64, pp. 3207-3220, 2016, ISSN 1053-587X.
ieee.title: Adaptive Detection of Point-Like Targets in Spectrally Symmetric Interference

ieee.displayText: Angelo Coluccia, Giuseppe Ricci, "A Tunable W-ABORT-Like Detector with Improved Detection vs Rejection Capabilities Trade-Off", Signal Processing Letters IEEE, vol. 22, pp. 713-717, 2015, ISSN 1070-9908.
ieee.title: A Tunable W-ABORT-Like Detector with Improved Detection vs Rejection Capabilities Trade-Off

ieee.displayText: Antonio De Maio, Danilo Orlando, Alfonso Farina, Goffredo Foglia, "Design and Analysis of Invariant Receivers for Gaussian Targets", Selected Topics in Signal Processing IEEE Journal of, vol. 9, pp. 1560-1569, 2015, ISSN 1932-4553.
ieee.title: Design and Analysis of Invariant Receivers for Gaussian Targets

ieee.displayText: Chengpeng Hao, Saeed Gazor, Goffredo Foglia, Bin Liu, Chaohuan Hou, "Persymmetric adaptive detection and range estimation of a small target", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 51, pp. 2590-2604, 2015, ISSN 0018-9251.
ieee.title: Persymmetric adaptive detection and range estimation of a small target
